name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden's win wasn't about his campaign. It was about Joe Biden, @IsaacDovere writes. https://t.co/WxAARlXtAy

name: TheAtlantic
text: “As Trump’s first term comes to a close, ‘A Face in the Crowd’ is worth revisiting—less for what it reveals about the president than for what it says about the rest of us,” @jaketapper wrote in our November issue. https://t.co/X2Iz1y4oTa

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The tasks facing Biden when he assumes the presidency are daunting. Not only must he address the worst pandemic in a century and revive the American economy, but he must also revitalize American democracy," @AdamSerwer writes: https://t.co/X7IS6cRYd7

name: TheAtlantic
text: A new poem by @officialdonika: "I think of you, in the spring soon come. / Friend, should you give a holler from your porch," https://t.co/5yay7vXndj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "You can’t understand the present without seeing the connections between this history and the socioeconomic and racial imbalances it created." Chuck Yarborough talked to @KristinaRizga about resetting students' understanding of the Civil War: https://t.co/bC9wt6V8ZM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Serious questions about America’s role in the world will not go away just because Donald Trump was defeated, @TomMcTague writes: https://t.co/lHj3l6om3q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Two new docuseries, "The Vow" and "Seduced," tell two very different stories about NXIVM and those who have escaped it. @sophieGG writes: https://t.co/MB6dQ0siX5

name: TheAtlantic
text: “You about to lose yo job,” a months-old warning from a Black woman to the officer detaining her, has become the protest song of the moment. @skornhaber on how demonstrators are creating new political anthems: https://t.co/y6Xl11HCwr

name: TheAtlantic
text: With a lit cigarette in hand and uncensored by NBC, Dave Chappelle took the "Saturday Night Live" stage for the first time in four years. In a 16-minute monologue, he explained why he didn't think a new president would save America, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/p6QPzEZ23Y

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @sophieGG: I wrote about The Vow and whether people who've escaped a cult are the most reliable narrators of what happened to them https://t.co/4pra9jlzyM

name: TheAtlantic
text: “FDT,” this era’s signature protest song, attracted attention for its outrage against Donald Trump, @skornhaber writes. But the track’s co-writer, the late Nipsey Hussle, knew that through carefully crafted verses, the song's message could create unity. https://t.co/ShiCdgt2Ez

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Hundreds of centuries-old European shipwrecks seem to have vanished without a trace. The suspected culprit? Worms, writes @MatthewHalliday. 
https://t.co/SCH2KIdgTE
